column4: Hi all.. need some help.. I just did an install from the alternate CD... BUT now I can figure out how to launch ubuntu.. I am stuck after the login
Is there a command I am not typing?
How do I get to the desktop?!!!!!
can you select Sessions (to gnome fail safe), before typing username to login in gdm?
What does that mean?  I don't know much about Linux yet
at the login prompt (graphic one), there's a place called either " Options ", or "Sessions", click to select
do you have the graphic one yet?
I followed the alternate instructions.
Well any ideas?
do you have the graphic login prompt (gdm) yet?
no.. Haven't got that far.. I thought that after the reboot from the install would have taken me there.. What do I need to do?
login at console (non-graphic one), do: sudo apt-get -f install ubuntu-desktop
thanks
it is now asking for a disk I do not have..  Or will the alternate CD work?
do you have network?
if it's connected, install via network
Umm.. internet?  I just put the alternte CD in.. It's running.. I don't know if its right or not
How do I do it?
clean up your /etc/apt/sources.list
I'm lost, and very new to this.
ask ubotu about easysource, you need to make a new /etc/apt/sources.list, then upgrade
They told me this was going to be easy... This has been a pain in the but from day one..   I have no idea what you are talking about with the easysource and what not.
